intro: Momisia tarijensis, commonly known as the Tarija momisia, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean regions of Bolivia and Peru. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and large, showy flowers that bloom in shades of pink and white. It thrives in high-altitude environments with cool, moist conditions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
